div.head: 上熱
div.div: heat in the upper [sections of the body]

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: heat in the upper [sections of the body]

sense.def: Pathological Condition of heat in the upper sections of the human body. Su wen 素問 71: 病 上熱血溢 , “The illnesses [caused by] them include heat in the upper [sections of the body] and overflowing blood”. LSZ identifies the following pathological conditions as the most important signs of heat in the upper sections: chuan man 喘滿 , panting and fullness; zhu ou 諸嘔 , all types of vomiting; tu suan 吐酸 ; sour spitting; xiong pi 胸痞 , obstacle-illness in the chest; xie tong 脅痛 , pain in the flanks; yin shi bu xiao 食飲不消 , inability to digest liquid and solid food; tou shang chu han 頭上出汗 , sweating on the head.
